title: Sculpture Classique
credit_line: Patrons Art Fund and John Henry Craner Fund
provenance_text:
Jean Arp [1886-1966], Meudon, France and Locarno, Switzerland, until December 1964 [1]; purchased from the artist by Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, May 1965 [2].

Notes:
[1]. The sculpture was no. 53 (illustrated in the catalogue) in "The 1964 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1964 - January 1965. It received one of two sculpture awards given at the exhibition. In addition to the bronze at the exhibition, which remained at Carnegie Institute, two other casts (2/3 and 3/3) were subsequently sold as a result of the exhibition to collectors in Baltimore (Pikesville), MD and Steubenville OH.
[2]. The sculpture was purchased by Carnegie Institute from the 1964 International. Payment to the artist (through Carnegie Institute's representative in France) was sent on December 17, 1964. The sculpture was accessioned the following year, on May 11, 1965.
